general_advisory: Farmers are advised to harvest the matured produce and store them at safe and dry places. Irrigate the field if soil is getting dry. Fertilisers and pesticides spray can be resumed in the early morning or evening hours.

advisory: Maintain a water level of 2 -3 cm in paddy field especially during Panicle initiation stage.
Monitor the paddy field regularly for diseases and pests.
To manage False smut disease, spray Propiconazole or Hexaconazole @ 100 ml or Copper oxychloride @ 250 g in 200 lt of water in an acre.
Take precautionary measures like spraying of pesticides if the pest attack is seen.
To control Rice stem borer, spray Neem oil 1500 ppm @ 1.5 -2 ml/lt.
In case of severe infestation of Rice stem borer, apply granular insecticide Chlorantraniliprole 0.4% GR @ 4 kg/acre or Fipronil 0.6% GR @ 4 kg/acre within 20 -25 days of transplanting.
Harvest the matured fruits.
To manage the infestation of Fruit flies, spray Malathion @ 1 ml/lt.
To control the Powdery mildew disease, spray Dinocap @ 1 ml/lt or Carbendazim @ 1 g/lt.
To manage Alternaria leaf blight, spray Carbendazim or Mancozeb @ 2 g/lt.
To control the infestation of Red pumpkin beetle, spray Malathion 50 EC @ 1 ml/lt or Methyl demeton 25 EC @ 1 ml/lt.
Do not make contact of the fruit with the soil as rotting can be seen.
Remove weeds from the root zone.
Uproot or destroy plants showing wilting symptoms away from the field.
To reduce Phomopsis blight disease, spray Metalaxyl + Mancozeb combination @ 400 g/acre or Zineb 75% WP @ 500 g/acre in 200 litres of water.
To manage Yellow vein mosaic virus, spray Quinalphos 25EC @ 2 lt/ha.
Control Fruit and shoot borer by spraying Emamectin benzoate @ 4g/10 lt.
Do not allow stagnation of water near the root zone.
To manage Papaya mosaic disease, spray Imidachloprid or Malathion @ 2 ml/lt.
Cover the bunch with a bag to protect it from monkeys.
Provide support to plants falling down due to bunch weight.
Give irrigation if possible.
